# Team Building Framework

## Purpose

When you're ready to scale beyond solo, this framework helps you hire, manage, and build culture effectively.

---

## When to Hire

### Ready to Hire When:

| Signal | Threshold |
|--------|-----------|
| Consistently overworked | 50+ hours/week for 3+ months |
| Missing opportunities | Revenue left on table |
| Quality suffering | Errors increasing |
| Can't take vacation | Business stops without you |
| Clear ROI | Hire pays for themselves |
| Repeatable work | Can document and delegate |

### Not Ready When:

- No documented processes
- Unclear what to delegate
- Can't afford 6+ months runway
- Don't know what success looks like
- Hiring to avoid doing the work yourself

---

## Hiring Stages

### Stage 1: Contractors/Freelancers
- No commitment
- Project-based
- Test before full hire
- Flexible scaling

### Stage 2: Part-Time Hires
- Consistent availability
- Lower commitment
- Good for specific functions
- 10-20 hours/week

### Stage 3: Full-Time Hires
- Complete dedication
- Full benefits/costs
- Deep investment
- 40+ hours/week

### Progression Path

```
Task → Freelancer → Contractor → Part-time → Full-time
        (test)       (validate)   (commit)    (invest)
```

---

## Role Definition

### Role Document Template

```markdown
## Role: {Title}

### Purpose
Why this role exists (one sentence).

### Responsibilities
- {Primary responsibility 1}
- {Primary responsibility 2}
- {Primary responsibility 3}

### Success Metrics
| Metric | Target | Timeframe |
|--------|--------|-----------|
| {metric} | {target} | {when} |

### Requirements
**Must have:**
- {Required skill/experience}
- {Required skill/experience}

**Nice to have:**
- {Preferred skill/experience}
- {Preferred skill/experience}

### Compensation
- Range: ${X} - ${Y}
- Type: {Salary/Hourly/Contract}
- Benefits: {if applicable}

### Working Arrangement
- Location: {Remote/Hybrid/Onsite}
- Hours: {Full-time/Part-time/Flexible}
- Timezone: {Requirements}
```

---

## Sourcing Candidates

### Where to Find People

| Source | Best For | Effort |
|--------|----------|--------|
| Network/Referrals | All roles | Low |
| LinkedIn | Professional roles | Medium |
| Industry communities | Specialized roles | Medium |
| Job boards | Volume | High |
| Twitter/X | Tech, creative | Medium |
| University/bootcamps | Entry-level | Medium |

### Job Posting Tips

**Good posting:**
- Clear title
- Specific responsibilities
- Honest about challenges
- Compensation range included
- Clear next steps

**Avoid:**
- Buzzword soup
- Unrealistic requirements
- Hidden compensation
- "Rock star" language
- Vague responsibilities

---

## Interview Process

### Structured Process

```
1. SCREEN (15-30 min)
   - Culture fit
   - Basic qualifications
   - Logistics

2. SKILLS (30-60 min)
   - Technical/functional ability
   - Problem-solving
   - Work samples

3. DEEP DIVE (60 min)
   - Detailed experience
   - Scenario questions
   - Mutual Q&A

4. FINAL (30-60 min)
   - Founder/team fit
   - Expectations alignment
   - Close
```

### Interview Questions

**For any role:**
- "Walk me through a project you're proud of."
- "Tell me about a time you failed and what you learned."
- "What does success look like for you in this role?"
- "What questions do you have for me?"

**For skills:**
- "How would you approach [specific scenario]?"
- "What's your process for [key responsibility]?"
- "Show me something you've built/done."

**For culture:**
- "How do you like to receive feedback?"
- "Describe your ideal working environment."
- "What motivates you?"

### Red Flags

| Red Flag | What It Signals |
|----------|-----------------|
| Can't explain past work | May not have done it |
| Blames others exclusively | Lacks accountability |
| No questions for you | Unengaged or desperate |
| Answers don't match resume | Honesty concerns |
| Negative about all past employers | Pattern issue |
| Unwilling to do work sample | Skill concerns |

---

## Hiring Scorecard

### Evaluation Framework

| Category | Weight | Score (1-5) | Notes |
|----------|--------|-------------|-------|
| Skills | 30% | | |
| Experience | 20% | | |
| Culture fit | 25% | | |
| Motivation | 15% | | |
| Communication | 10% | | |
| **Total** | 100% | | |

### Scoring Guide

| Score | Meaning |
|-------|---------|
| 5 | Exceptional - Exceeds requirements significantly |
| 4 | Strong - Exceeds requirements |
| 3 | Good - Meets requirements |
| 2 | Weak - Below requirements |
| 1 | Poor - Significant concerns |

### Decision Framework

| Total Score | Decision |
|-------------|----------|
| 4.5+ | Strong hire |
| 3.5-4.4 | Good hire, address gaps |
| 2.5-3.4 | Proceed with caution |
| < 2.5 | Pass |

---

## Onboarding New Hires

### First Week Goals

- [ ] Access to all tools/systems
- [ ] Met key stakeholders
- [ ] Understands priorities
- [ ] Has first task
- [ ] Knows how to get help
- [ ] Feedback loop established

### 30-60-90 Day Plan

**Day 30:**
- Fully onboarded
- Contributing independently
- Relationships established

**Day 60:**
- Meeting performance expectations
- Integrated into workflows
- Minimal hand-holding needed

**Day 90:**
- Full productivity
- Taking ownership
- Adding value beyond role

### Onboarding Checklist

```markdown
## Onboarding: {Name}

### Before Start
- [ ] Send welcome message
- [ ] Create accounts/access
- [ ] Prepare equipment (if applicable)
- [ ] Schedule first week meetings

### Week 1
- [ ] Welcome call/meeting
- [ ] Share key documents
- [ ] Introduce to team/stakeholders
- [ ] Assign first project
- [ ] Daily check-ins

### Week 2-4
- [ ] Deeper training
- [ ] More independence
- [ ] Regular 1:1s
- [ ] First feedback

### Month 2-3
- [ ] Full workload
- [ ] Performance check
- [ ] Adjust as needed
- [ ] 90-day review
```

---

## Managing People

### 1:1 Meetings

**Frequency:** Weekly for new hires, bi-weekly for established

**Agenda:**
1. Their updates (not status, but concerns/wins)
2. Feedback (both directions)
3. Blockers/support needed
4. Career/growth discussion
5. Priorities for next period

### Feedback Framework

**Constructive feedback:**
```
"I noticed [specific behavior] in [situation].
The impact was [consequence].
Going forward, I'd like to see [specific change].
How can I support you with this?"
```

**Recognition:**
```
"Great work on [specific thing].
This helped us [impact].
I especially appreciated [specific aspect].
Keep it up!"
```

### Performance Issues

| Stage | Action |
|-------|--------|
| First occurrence | Verbal feedback |
| Pattern emerges | Written documentation |
| No improvement | Formal warning |
| Continued issues | Performance plan |
| Plan fails | Separation |

---

## Culture Building

### Culture Principles

**Define explicitly:**
- How we communicate
- How we make decisions
- How we handle conflict
- What we value
- What we won't tolerate

### Remote Culture Tips

- Over-communicate
- Document everything
- Schedule social time
- Be timezone-aware
- Trust by default
- Measure output, not hours

### Warning Signs

| Signal | May Indicate |
|--------|--------------|
| Decreased communication | Disengagement |
| Quality drop | Burnout or issues |
| Avoiding meetings | Conflict or unhappiness |
| Sudden formality | Trust breakdown |
| Complaints from others | Behavior problems |

---

## Output Format

```markdown
## Hiring Plan: {Role}

### Role Summary
| Aspect | Detail |
|--------|--------|
| Title | {title} |
| Type | {Full-time/Part-time/Contract} |
| Compensation | ${X} - ${Y} |
| Timeline | Hire by {date} |

### Must-Haves
1. {Requirement}
2. {Requirement}

### Interview Process
1. {Stage}: {interviewer}, {duration}
2. {Stage}: {interviewer}, {duration}

### Sourcing Plan
- {Channel 1}: {approach}
- {Channel 2}: {approach}

### Success Metrics (90-day)
- {Metric}: {target}
- {Metric}: {target}
```
